poem:
A New Rhythm  

In the clatter of keys, a pause—  
not in the speed of fingers,  
but in the breath of a day.  
A child, home in the sunlight,  
asks a question—  
a leaf falls—  
work echoes in tender seams,  
and time folds, gently bending.  
Against the clock's ceaseless tick,  
something quiet stirs,  
a softer clock.

For obvious reasons, these productivity experiments relate to adult working life. But what if". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
